prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by reading through all the given information carefully.

First, I'll look at the testimonies. There are four testimonies from the witness Armstrong. Let's break them down:

1. **Testimony 0**: "La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves."
   - This seems to be about the placement of a mirror in the restaurant, dividing two sections. It mentions something about "z'e two 'alves," which might be a translation issue. Maybe it refers to two sections or parts of the restaurant.

2. **Testimony 1**: "Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim."
   - This testimony suggests that there's only one specific seat where someone could see the victim, likely implying that the victim was at that seat or that the view was obstructed from other seats.

3. **Testimony 2**: "Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting."
   - Here, the witness mentions a specific seat next to the victim's table where an old man was sitting. This seems to indicate that there was a particular seat associated with the old man.

4. **Testimony 3**: "After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way."
   - This testimony talks about moving a mirror after the incident to avoid obstructing something, possibly the view of the crime scene.

Now, looking at the evidence, I need to find which one contradicts these testimonies.

- **Evidence 12 (Tres Bien Floor Plans)**: Describes the crime scene layout, mentioning that the view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio. This suggests that the layout of the restaurant limited visibility from certain areas.

- **Evidence 13 (Crime Photo)**: Shows two dining tables separated by a folding screen. The closer table to the camera is empty, and the victim collapsed on the other table. An intact vase is on each table, a coffee cup is knocked over, and the tablecloth is stained with coffee. Papers are near the coffee table.

Now, looking for contradictions:

- **Testimony 0** mentions a mirror in the middle of the restaurant, dividing two sections. However, the **Crime Photo** shows a folding screen separating the tables, not a mirror. This could be a contradiction because the mirror described in the testimony isn't reflected in the crime scene evidence.

- **Testimony 1** states there's only one seat from which the victim could be seen. The **Tres Bien Floor Plans** indicate that the view from the entrance is obstructed, supporting this testimony. However, the **Crime Photo** shows that the victim's table is on the opposite side of the folding screen, which might mean that others couldn't see him. This could be consistent, but I need to see if any testimonies contradict the evidence more directly.

- **Testimony 2** mentions an old man sitting at a specific seat next to the victim. The **Crime Photo** doesn't mention anyone sitting across from the victim, which could be consistent if the old man was sitting elsewhere, but it's not directly contradictory.

- **Testimony 3** mentions moving a mirror after the incident. The **Crime Photo** shows a folding screen, not a mirror, so this seems to be a contradiction because the testimony refers to a mirror, but the evidence shows a folding screen.

However, the most direct contradiction seems to be between **Testimony 0** and **Evidence 12** or **Evidence 13**. The testimony mentions a mirror, while the evidence shows a folding screen. Since the folding screen is part of the crime scene, the mirror described in the testimony doesn't align with the evidence.

Therefore, the evidence that contradicts the testimony is **Evidence 12 (Tres Bien Floor Plans)** and **Evidence 13 (Crime Photo)** contradicting **Testimony 0**.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's dive into this case. So, from what I understand, there's a murder at Tres Bien, a restaurant, and the prime suspect is Maggey Byrde, the waitressing. But Phoenix Wright, our protagonist, is stepping in to defend her. The main point of contention seems to be whether Maggey actually committed the murder or if someone else is to blame.

Looking at the evidence, there's a lot pointing towards Maggey. The Coffee Cup found at the crime scene had potassium cyanide in it, and both Maggey's and Glen Elg's fingerprints were on it. That's a strong link between her and the murder. Additionally, the victim, Glen Elg, was found with a winning lottery ticket, which suggests he was excited about winning money, something that could have led to his actions.

But then there's the testimony from Jean Armstrong, the owner of Tres Bien. She says that Maggey was serving drinks when the victim suddenly collapsed. She also mentions that Maggey seemed nervous after the incident. This testimony seems to support the idea that Maggey was involved in some way.

However, there's also a note from Victor Kudo, who was in the restaurant that day. He claims that the vase at his table was knocked over, causing a commotion, and that the real killer was someone else. This creates a contradiction because if Victor is telling the truth, then Maggey might not be the one who poisoned Glen Elg.

But wait, let's dig deeper. The Crime Photo shows that the vase was indeed knocked over, and Victor's note supports that. However, the presence of Maggey's fingerprints on the coffee cup and the fact that she was serving drinks at the time of the incident suggests she had access to the poison. It seems like Maggey could have been the one to lace the coffee with cyanide, but the vase being knocked over might have been a distraction or an attempt to frame someone else.

There's also the issue of the Lottery Ticket. Glen won a significant amount, which could explain his excitement, but it doesn't directly link to his death. However, the fact that Maggey was found with the ticket adds to the suspicion that she might have been involved in some financial scheme with him.

Considering all this, the key points are:
1. The Coffee Cup with Maggey's fingerprints had cyanide.
2. Victor's testimony about the vase being knocked over.
3. The presence of Maggey near Glen during the collapse.

These seem to create a conflict because if Maggey was serving drinks, she could have access to the cyanide, but Victor's claim suggests that someone else was responsible for the vase being knocked over. However, the primary evidence against Maggey is the cyanide in the coffee, which is a direct link to her.

So, the contradiction lies in Victor's testimony about the vase versus the evidence of Maggey's fingerprints on the coffee. While Victor might have been trying to divert attention, the cyanide in the coffee is a more concrete piece of evidence pointing to Maggey's involvement.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm trying to figure out which piece of evidence contradicts which testimony. There's a lot to go through, so I'll start by listing out the key points from both the evidence and the testimonies.

First, looking at the testimonies, there are two main ones that stand out. Testimony 0 says, "I don't know nothin' about no murder," and Testimony 4 says, "Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta." These seem to be from Furio Tigre, who's the head of Tender Lender. He's talking about not knowing anything about the murder and suggesting that Violetta can provide an alibi.

Now, looking at the evidence, I see several pieces that might relate to Tigre's alibi. Evidence 25 mentions a repair bill paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family. This suggests that Tigre was involved in some business dealings around that time. Additionally, Evidence 24 talks about matches found at Tender Lender, which might indicate that the business was operational or had some activity around the incident.

Putting this together, if Tigre claims he was tied up in business and never saw the victim, but there's evidence of his business activities around the time of the crime, it creates a contradiction. The evidence supports that he was involved in transactions, which contradicts his testimony about not knowing anything about the murder and needing Violetta as an alibi.

So, the evidence (25 and 24) contradicts the testimony (0 and 4). Therefore, the pair is Evidence 25 and Testimony 0/4.
</think>

'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.

Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.

Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."

Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!

Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".

Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!

Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.

Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
The head of Tender Lender loan company.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I ain't no liar. I never met Glen Elg.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: There was some lame guy with that name, though. Wanted to borrow cash from me.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: I set up a meetin' with the guy... at my office, Tender Lender.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I waited around for him, but he ain't ever showed.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: I ain't never been to that Tres Bien joint, youse hear?
Person: Tigre

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure this out. So, I'm looking at the evidence and testimonies provided, and I need to find a pair that contradicts each other. The user mentioned that I should only answer one pair, so I need to carefully examine each piece of evidence and testimony to see where they conflict.

First, I'll go through the list of characters to get a sense of the scenario. There's Maya Fey, her sister Mia, who is a mentor, Godot, a mysterious prosecutor, Dick Gumshoe, a detective, Maggey Byrde, a waitress, Jean Armstrong, the owner of Tres Bien, Glen Elg, the victim, Victor Kudo, a customer, Lisa Basil, Glen's boss, Violetta Cadaverini, possibly part of the staff, Furio Tigre, the head of a loan company, and Bruto Cadaverini, the head of a crime syndicate.

Now, looking at the evidences:

- **Evidence 25**: Repair Bill for $15,000 paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family. This indicates that Tigre had a financial transaction with the Cadaverini Family around the time of the incident.

- **Testimony 0**: Tigre claims he never met Glen Elg and that he didn't see Glen at Tres Bien.

- **Testimony 1**: Tigre mentions that there was a "lame guy" with Glen's name who wanted to borrow cash but never showed up.

- **Testimony 2**: Tigre set up a meeting with the guy (Glen) at his office but says Glen didn't show.

- **Testimony 4**: Tigre claims he's never been to Tres Bien.

So, the key points here are whether Tigre met Glen or not. The repair bill (Evidence 25) suggests that Tigre had some business dealings with the Cadaverini Family, possibly around the time of the incident. However, Tigre's testimonies indicate he didn't meet Glen and that he wasn't at Tres Bien. 

If the repair bill was paid around the time of the incident, it might suggest that Tigre was involved in some capacity, possibly related to the crime. But Tigre claims he didn't interact with Glen or go to Tres Bien, which could mean he's lying or that the repair bill is unrelated to the crime. This creates a contradiction because the repair bill ties him to the Cadaverini Family, who might be involved, but his testimonies suggest he had no direct interaction with Glen or the crime scene.

Therefore, the evidence (Repair Bill) and testimony (Tigre's claims) contradict each other because the bill suggests involvement, while his testimonies deny any direct role or presence at Tres Bien.
</think>

cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. There are so many pieces of evidence and testimonies, so I need to carefully go through them to spot any contradictions.

First, I'll list out the key pieces of evidence and testimonies to have a clear overview.

**Evidences:**
1. **Attorney's Badge**: Phoenix Wright's badge, showing he's a defense attorney.
2. **Maya's Magatama**: Reacts to people with secrets. Found in Tres Bien's kitchen.
3. **Magazine Clipping**: An article about Phoenix being trounced and his client found guilty.
4. **Sports Paper**: Doodle with 'MC Bomber', '100,000' crossed out, and laughing faces. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd, in the victim's handwriting.
5. **Job Listings**: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square, thrown away by the old man.
6. **Lunch Special**: Tres Bien's 20-dollar lunch special, tastes bad.
7. **Small Bottle**: Found in the kitchen. Victim's ear medicine, covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
8. **Scooter**: Ridden by the phony. Wheel guard smashed up.
9. **Jean's Loan Contract**: Jean's debt is half a million, loaned by Tender Lender.
10. **Victor's Note**: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo".
11. **Glen's Autopsy Report**: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning, between 1:30-2:30 PM.
12. **Tres Bien Floor Plans**: Blueprints showing the crime scene, X marks the victim's seat.
13. **Crime Photo**: Two dining tables separated by a screen. Victim collapses on one table, vase intact on both. Coffee cup knocked over, tablecloth stained, papers near the coffee table.
14. **Coffee Cup**: Contains potassium cyanide, covered in victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
15. **Victim's Lottery Ticket**: Winning ticket for half a million, found on Maggey.
16. **Apron**: Worn by Maggey, stained, small pockets.
17. **Potassium Cyanide**: Found in Maggey's apron pocket, deadly poison.
18. **Victim's Prescription Bag**: Empty, from the doctor.
19. **Victor's Testimony**: Broke the vase at his seat, apologized.
20. **Millionaire Radio Flyer**: Experience ten minutes of thrill every Monday at 1:30 PM.
21. **Glen's Calendar**: Note says "Meet with The Tiger" on Dec. 3rd.
22. **Losing Horse Racing Tickets**: Over 500 tickets found in Glen's desk.
23. **Gumshoe's Lunchbox**: Handmade, filled with love and weenies.
24. **MC Bomber**: Found at Tender Lender, contains a virus by Glen, worth millions.
25. **Tres Bien Matches**: Advertising matches found in Tender Lender.
26. **Repair Bill**: 15,000$ bill paid by Tigre to Cadaverini.
27. **Paper Badge**: Found at Tender Lender, looks authentic but is cardboard.
28. **Viola's Medical Papers**: 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery, due last year.

**Testimonies:**
0. **Tigre**: "I was supposed to meet with the kid at the restaurant that afternoon."
1. **Tigre**: "When I opened the door to the joint, I saw one ugly scene."
2. **Tigre**: "The guy was laid out over the table, stiff as concrete."
3. **Tigre**: "I figured if the place wasn't hot already, it was gonna be, so I split."
4. **Tigre**: "I heard the cop's sirens on my way out, and I went straight back to my office."

Now, looking for contradictions. Let's see:

- **Evidence 25 (Repair Bill)**: Paid by Tigre to Cadaverini. **Testimony 0**: Tigre was supposed to meet the kid at the restaurant that afternoon. **Testimony 1**: He saw an ugly scene when he opened the door. **Testimony 2**: The guy was stiff. **Testimony 3**: He split after seeing the scene. **Testimony 4**: He went back to his office after hearing sirens.

Looking at **Evidence 25**, the repair bill was paid by Tigre, but according to his testimonies, he was at the restaurant around the time of the incident, not at his office. This suggests Tigre couldn't have been at his office paying the repair bill at the time of the crime. Therefore, **Evidence 25** contradicts **Testimony 0-4**.

So, the pair that contradicts is Evidence 25 and Testimony 0-4.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in the provided list. There are a lot of characters, evidences, and testimonies, so I'll start by carefully reviewing each piece of information.

First, I'll go through the testimonies to understand what each one is saying. Testimony 0 from Tigre says he loaned Glen Elg $100,000. Testimony 1 mentions that Tigre was supposed to meet Elg at the restaurant that afternoon. Testimony 2 describes what Tigre saw when he arrived—Elg was laid out over the table, stiff as concrete. Testimony 3 says Tigre was about to flatten Elg but then started screaming. Testimony 4 talks about Elg's excitement over winning the lottery, and Testimony 5 and 6 relate to Maggey's actions and the consequences for Tigre's business.

Now, looking at the evidences, Evidence 25 is the Repair Bill, which is a $15,000 car repair bill paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family. This seems to be related to Tigre's actions, but I need to see how it connects to the testimonies.

The testimonies mention that Tigre loaned Elg $100,000 (Testimony 0) and was supposed to meet him (Testimony 1). However, the Repair Bill (Evidence 25) shows a payment of $15,000 to the Cadaverini Family, which might not align with the $100,000 loan mentioned. Additionally, Testimony 3 indicates that Tigre was going to flatten Elg but then changed his mind, suggesting some unexpected behavior.

But the key contradiction seems to be between Testimony 0 and Evidence 25. Testimony 0 states that Tigre loaned Elg $100,000, but the Repair Bill shows a payment of only $15,000. This discrepancy suggests that Tigre might not have loaned Elg the full $100,000 as he claimed, or perhaps the loan was for a different purpose, contradicting the Repair Bill.

Another point is Testimony 3, where Tigre was about to act but then changed his mind. This unexpected action might indicate that Tigre's story is inconsistent, further supporting the contradiction with the Repair Bill.

However, focusing on the main evidence and testimony pair, the Repair Bill (Evidence 25) and Testimony 0 contradict each other because Testimony 0 claims a $100,000 loan, while the Repair Bill shows a $15,000 payment, which doesn't align with the loan amount mentioned.
</think>
